string.text: There's a military squad seen on the road. I really doubt I'll be able to get to the Sarcophagus myself, so I should offer them my help to discover anything that'd help me get into that place.

The military squad wants to occupy the high ground, and their leader - Lt. Dudaev - promised to introduce me to their commander if I help the guys: I'm pretty sure he knows where the Sarcophagus entrance is.
We need to gain a foothold near the gate and hold out positions, waiting for the helicopters to arrive.
The helicopters haven't done the job... which means we'll have to deal with the BTR on our own.
Those Monolithians again... damned fanatics! We need to deal with them till they haven't clapped all of the soldiers.
Well, the assholes are decently equipped indeed! I wonder where... but it's not the time. I need to get rid of the RPG guys unless I want to scrape the guys' brains off the walls.
Oh, come on! A wave of mutants is heading towards us, so we need to do something about it. Besides, I'm pretty sure there are some fanatics left around...
Well, I helped the military and Dudaev's kept his promise: he'll introduce me to the commander. I need to get to him and ask about the Sarcophagus.
I've agreed to help the military take out the Monolithians. They even let me use a BTR to take the assholes out! That's another childhood dream come true...
There's a Duty squad billeted on the NPP outskirts. I should offer the guys my help - and perhaps, they'll tell me how to get into the Sarcophagus.
I need to place the transceiver as near to the BTR as possible so the helicopters can take it out, and then move in and eliminate the Monolith threat.
The leader of the Duty squad asked me to track down the recon group which searched for the entrance to some underground. Isn't it the Sarcophagus? If so, I need to find the guys for sure.
Code that opens the Sarcophagus entrance door at ChNPP is 4237.
